clinical_study.brief_title: Serum and Intraocular Levels of Erythropoietin and VEGF in Type 2 Diabetes Patients With Proliferative Retinopathy

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular concentration of Erythropoietin and VEGF.

arm_group.description: Diabetic patients who underwent vitrectomy for Proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy
Non-diabetic patients who underwent vitrectomy for macular hole or pucker

study_pop.textblock:
Case: type 2 diabetic patients with PDR who had to undergo vitrectomy during the period May 2011-January 2012 at the Unit of Ophthalmology, A.O. Civil Hospital and University of Brescia.
Control: non-diabetic patients who underwent vitrectomy for macular hole or pucker.

criteria.textblock:
CASE
Inclusion criteria:
- type 2 diabetes,
- age greater than 18 years, and
- PDR.
Exclusion criteria were:
- age less than 18 years,
- type 1 diabetes,
- initial DR,
- PDR patients not requiring surgery,
- previous vitrectomy in the eye under examination or other ophthalmic surgery or laser therapy within the previous 3 months.
CONTROL
Inclusion criteria:
- age greater than 18 years and the presence of macular pucker or macular hole requiring vitrectomy.
Exclusion criteria were:
- age less than 18 years,
- diagnosis of diabetes mellitus, and
- previous vitrectomy in the eye under examination or other ophthalmic surgery or laser therapy within the previous 3 months.
